notes: The targeting reticule must be centered over an enemy unit

The projectile travels at a speed of 1000 and has 225 radius flying vision
 This vision does not last
Turning invulnerable or hidden does not prevent it from affecting the area around the target
Storm Hammer first applies the dispel, then the damage, then the debuff
Sven's sword emits some particles during the cast time, visible to everyone

SCEPTER NOTES Sven is now moved along with the projectile at the same speed While being moved, Sven is untargetable, invulnerable, hidden and is prevented from acting Does not disjoints projectiles Autocast on disables being moved with the ability projectile Sven stops moving along with the projectile in the following conditions: When Storm Hammer is disjointed Upon Sven's death If the distance between Sven and the target exceeds 2200 If the movement is interrupted (e.g with teleport), Sven is also no longer disabled, untargetable and invulnerable The ability upgrade is determined if Sven has [picture:aghanim's_scepter] Aghanim's Scepter equipped during its cast point Therefore, losing Aghanim's Scepter while being moved does not stop Sven from being moved along with the projectile

SCEPTER NOTES Storm Hammer can now also be cast on invulnerable enemies
 Although the damage and stun do not affect invulnerable units, the basic dispel does
 This means if the source of invulnerability is dispellable, Storm Hammer may fully affect the target, since the dispel is applied first
 The dispel is applied on all hit enemies within 255 radius along with the primary target
abilities.description: Sven unleashes his magical gauntlet that deals damage and stuns enemy units in a small area around the target.
abilities.name: Storm Hammer
abilities.story: The Rogue Knight's iron gauntlet, taken from the school of his father, strikes his foes to their core.

notes:
Cleave damage has the following properties: It counts as spell damage
 However, it has the following flags: No-spell-lifesteal flag, preventing its damage from utilizing spell lifesteal
 No-spell-amplification flag, preventing its damage from being amplified with spell damage amplification
 Cleave damage depends on the attack damage value of the cleaving unit, not on how much their primary attack target took
 It is reduced by damage block

The complete cleave area is shaped like an isocseles trapezoid in front of the attacking unit Multiple sources of cleave fully stack and work independently Does not cleave upon attacking wards, buildings or allied units [picture:animal_courier_radiant_minimap] Couriers, wards and buildings are unaffected by cleave Despite the visual effect, the cleave damage is applied instantly in the whole area
abilities.description: Sven strikes with great force, cleaving all nearby enemy units with his attack.
abilities.name: Great Cleave
abilities.story: The Vigil Knights still seek to reclaim the stolen Outcast Blade from Sven, a weapon capable of cutting wide swaths through lesser warriors.

notes: Interrupts Sven's channeling abilities upon cast
Only affects allied heroes, including clones, illusions and creep-heroes
Leveling up the ability or the armor bonus increasing or movement speed bonus increasing [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talents do not update already existing Warcry buffs

SHARD NOTES Adds a passive component to Warcry, with the active effects still present Warcry now passively affects all allies, including creeps, within 1200 radius and the aura buff lingers for 0.5 seconds Does not affect buildings and wards Neither affects invulnerable nor hidden allies as well However, it fully affects ally [picture:animal_courier_radiant_minimap] Couriers While active, Warcry grants Sven a total of 12/15/18/21 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 22/25/28/31) bonus armor
abilities.description: Sven's Warcry heartens his allied heroes for battle, increasing their armor and movement speed. Lasts 9 seconds.
abilities.name: Warcry
abilities.story: Calling a few lines from the Vigil Codex fortifies Sven's obedience to his rogue code. So poetic!

notes:
Grants flat bonus attack damage based on Sven's main attack damage
 Does not further increase bonus attack damage
 Sven's current main attack damage is periodically checked and the bonuses are adapted instantly
Leveling up the ability and the damage increasing [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talent do not update an already existing God's Strength buff
abilities.description: Sven channels his rogue strength, granting bonus damage for 35 seconds.
abilities.name: God's Strength
abilities.story: With the strength that shattered the Sacred Helm, the Rogue Knight stands unopposed in melee combat.

description: Cleaves down enemies with his incredible strength. The Rogue Knight lives by two creeds: Honor, as ordained by his own personal code, and Solitude. Always eager to charge into a fight. Using his iron gauntlet, he launches a Storm Hammer, stunning grouped enemies as he transports himself into battle, then closes in to cut them down with Great Cleave. Letting out a truly frightening Warcry, he ignites and calls upon God's Strength, a few swings of his gargantuan sword are often more than enough to slay on his hapless foes.  Carry Disabler Initiator Durable Nuker ★☆☆
trivia: Sven is named after Danish bodybuilder and actor Sven-Ole Thorsen. In earlier versions of DotA, Sven had the fun name "Arnold Schwarzenegger".
In earlier versions of DotA, Sven had the fun name "Arnold Schwarzenegger".
The phrases " Link▶️ Twas only a flesh wound" and " Link▶️ It was but a scratch" are references to the Black Knight from Monty Python and the Holy Grail.

The phrases " Link▶️ Blame the host" and " Link▶️ Bad host" are references to the original Warcraft III DotA gameplay when game stability depended on the quality of internet connection on the host player.

Storm Hammer was named Storm Bolt in the early beta phases and was renamed into Storm Hammer at one point. It is also its original name in DotA 1 and reflected in one of Sven's cast responses in Dota 2, where he is referring to it as Link▶️ "Storm Bolt". Rubick also has the same response when stealing Storm Hammer.
Rubick also has the same response when stealing Storm Hammer.
history: Sven is the bastard son of a Vigil Knight, born of a Pallid Meranth, raised in the Shadeshore Ruins. With his father executed for violating the Vigil Codex, and his mother shunned by her wild race, Sven believes that honor is to be found in no social order, but only in himself. After tending his mother through a lingering death, he offered himself as a novice to the Vigil Knights, never revealing his identity. For thirteen years he studied in his father's school, mastering the rigid code that declared his existence an abomination. Then, on the day that should have been his In-Swearing, he seized the Outcast Blade, shattered the Sacred Helm, and burned the Codex in the Vigil's Holy Flame. He strode from Vigil Keep, forever solitary, following his private code to the last strict rune. Still a knight, yes...but a rogue knight. He answers only to himself.
